body:
Are you using an input method, and if so which one?

Please post the `events` log of you pressing a key.
[Sounds like](http://forum.lwjgl.org/index.php?topic=5850.msg31209#msg31209) one of our users has the same issue. LWJGL uses a GLFW build with the latest changes too.

This is what happens when I run the events executable from command line:

```
00000005 to 1 at 1.554: Character 0x00000077 (w) with modifiers (with no mods) input
00000006 to 1 at 1.554: Character 0x00000077 (w) input
00000007 to 1 at 1.850: Character 0x00000061 (a) with modifiers (with no mods) input
00000008 to 1 at 1.850: Character 0x00000061 (a) input
00000009 to 1 at 2.154: Character 0x00000073 (s) with modifiers (with no mods) input
0000000a to 1 at 2.154: Character 0x00000073 (s) input
0000000b to 1 at 2.450: Character 0x00000064 (d) with modifiers (with no mods) input
0000000c to 1 at 2.450: Character 0x00000064 (d) input
0000000d to 1 at 2.722: Character 0x00000077 (w) with modifiers (with no mods) input
0000000e to 1 at 2.722: Character 0x00000077 (w) input
0000000f to 1 at 3.042: Character 0x00000061 (a) with modifiers (with no mods) input
00000010 to 1 at 3.042: Character 0x00000061 (a) input
00000011 to 1 at 3.330: Character 0x00000073 (s) with modifiers (with no mods) input
00000012 to 1 at 3.330: Character 0x00000073 (s) input
00000013 to 1 at 3.586: Character 0x00000064 (d) with modifiers (with no mods) input
00000014 to 1 at 3.586: Character 0x00000064 (d) input
```

While this is the output for glfw 3.1.1:

```
00000005 to 1 at 1.555: Key 0x0057 Scancode 0x0019 (W) (with no mods) was pressed
00000006 to 1 at 1.555: Character 0x00000077 (w) with modifiers (with no mods) input
00000007 to 1 at 1.555: Character 0x00000077 (w) input
00000008 to 1 at 1.691: Key 0x0057 Scancode 0x0019 (W) (with no mods) was released
00000009 to 1 at 1.907: Key 0x0041 Scancode 0x0026 (A) (with no mods) was pressed
0000000a to 1 at 1.907: Character 0x00000061 (a) with modifiers (with no mods) input
0000000b to 1 at 1.907: Character 0x00000061 (a) input
0000000c to 1 at 2.019: Key 0x0041 Scancode 0x0026 (A) (with no mods) was released
0000000d to 1 at 2.235: Key 0x0053 Scancode 0x0027 (S) (with no mods) was pressed
0000000e to 1 at 2.235: Character 0x00000073 (s) with modifiers (with no mods) input
0000000f to 1 at 2.235: Character 0x00000073 (s) input
00000010 to 1 at 2.363: Key 0x0053 Scancode 0x0027 (S) (with no mods) was released
00000011 to 1 at 2.643: Key 0x0044 Scancode 0x0028 (D) (with no mods) was pressed
00000012 to 1 at 2.643: Character 0x00000064 (d) with modifiers (with no mods) input
00000013 to 1 at 2.643: Character 0x00000064 (d) input
00000014 to 1 at 2.763: Key 0x0044 Scancode 0x0028 (D) (with no mods) was released
00000015 to 1 at 3.131: Key 0x0057 Scancode 0x0019 (W) (with no mods) was pressed
00000016 to 1 at 3.131: Character 0x00000077 (w) with modifiers (with no mods) input
00000017 to 1 at 3.131: Character 0x00000077 (w) input
00000018 to 1 at 3.267: Key 0x0057 Scancode 0x0019 (W) (with no mods) was released
00000019 to 1 at 3.459: Key 0x0041 Scancode 0x0026 (A) (with no mods) was pressed
0000001a to 1 at 3.459: Character 0x00000061 (a) with modifiers (with no mods) input
0000001b to 1 at 3.459: Character 0x00000061 (a) input
0000001c to 1 at 3.603: Key 0x0041 Scancode 0x0026 (A) (with no mods) was released
0000001d to 1 at 3.819: Key 0x0053 Scancode 0x0027 (S) (with no mods) was pressed
0000001e to 1 at 3.819: Character 0x00000073 (s) with modifiers (with no mods) input
0000001f to 1 at 3.819: Character 0x00000073 (s) input
00000020 to 1 at 3.931: Key 0x0053 Scancode 0x0027 (S) (with no mods) was released
00000021 to 1 at 4.115: Key 0x0044 Scancode 0x0028 (D) (with no mods) was pressed
00000022 to 1 at 4.115: Character 0x00000064 (d) with modifiers (with no mods) input
00000023 to 1 at 4.115: Character 0x00000064 (d) input
00000024 to 1 at 4.227: Key 0x0044 Scancode 0x0028 (D) (with no mods) was released
```

Also, I don't know what you mean by  input method. I set a key callback function within my code, that I then use to fill a `key_pressed_tracker_` boolean array, but the callback function is never even entered.
I second this issue. Latest changes with XIM detection broke the callback for keys. Only the characters callback is called. But all works fine on 3.1.1-release.

A user on IRC reported an Issue that the ESC key event did not register, I found out that commit cf4206d987d8b74964b11d1ccac38efddc0b7684 broke the ESC key event.

Reproduce: launch `events` and press the ESC key. I assume this is related to this issue.

OS: Archlinux with Gnome 3.17 and Archlinux with i3.

I've experienced this too.
Using the current master branch, keyboard input is broken on SteamOS, but works on Ubuntu 14.
v3.1.1 works on both.
Which [input method](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Input_method) frameworks are you all using?

Cloned and built master branch and key callback is not called for me as well. Using linux mint 17.1 Rebecca. I verified event output as shown in previous post (ie event test never calls key callback). Also verified with qt creator debugger that all other callbacks do fire - its only the key callback
I use a standard English QWERTY keyboard layout with X11 on Ubuntu 14.04 for an input method.
What is the `XMODIFIERS` environment variable set to on your machines?
